title: AI Workload System Stability
description: Troubleshoot BSOD, Black Screens, and unexpected reboots during heavy compute tasks.

steps.title: Check Event Viewer
steps.instruction: Run 'eventvwr.msc' → Windows Logs → System. Look for 'Critical' errors like 'Kernel-Power' or 'Display driver nvlddmkm stopped responding'.

steps.title: Disable Overclocking
steps.instruction: Reset BIOS settings to default and disable GPU overclocking (MSI Afterburner/EVGA Precision). AI workloads are extremely sensitive to instability.

steps.title: Verify Power Supply
steps.instruction: Ensure your PSU has enough wattage for peak CPU+GPU load. High compute tasks can cause voltage drops and reboots.

steps.title: Test RAM Stability
steps.instruction: Run 'Windows Memory Diagnostic' or MemTest86. Defective RAM often causes crashes only under high usage.

steps.title: Limit Resource Usage
steps.instruction: Use 'cpulimit' or set power limits in NVIDIA Control Panel to reduce peak draw and improve thermal stability.
